Title: Air meets Water
Description: Base of a cedar wood plank, carved with additional inlaid composite created from aluminium, animal bone ash and graphite. Three vertical carved cedar wood scultpures on steel dowelling pedestals, two are painted. Three vertical sculptures include carved representations of a raven, eagle, orca with coppers in beak of raven and copper wings on the eagle.

Title: Kaleidoscope eye
Description: Kaleidoscope eye painting by Luke & Morgan Choice/AvantForm

Title: Independence Monument
Description: The Independence Monument is a victory column located on Maidan Nezalezhnosti (Independence Square) in Kyiv, commemorating the independence of Ukraine in 1991. A spiral staircase is contained within the column

Title: Dancing in the street
Description: Fusion of artistic works (hand painting, Indian inks and acrylic painting + digital work, texture varnish ...) creating unique, matte and glossy texture effects.

Title: Hearts and a Watercolor
Description: Eight hearts with various decorations. 1969 Etching and watercolour on Chrisbrook handmade paper

Title: Untitled (O'Ryan)
Description: Materials: chromogenic print (Fujicolor)

Title: Courage My Love
Description: Moon's Daughter had never been so far from home; she wished for glimpses of her father's crescent smile. 'Courage, my love.' said Fox, 'Even in shadow, I see pockets of moonlight in your eyes'. Story excerpt from 'Courage, My Love' by Liam McKinnon.

Title: Mona Lisa
Description: The Mona Lisa is one of the most valuable paintings in the world.

Title: Paris Street; Rainy Day
Description: This artwork is currently owned by the Art Institute of Chicago.

Title: Maman
Description: Maman is located at the National Gallery of Canada in Ottawa.

Title: Cloud Gate
Description: This sculpture is created by an Indian-born British artist.

Title: Wanderer above the Sea of Fog
Description: This artwork is created by a German artist.

Description: This artwork is located in Kunsthaus Zürich.

Title: Tiny bunny love
Description: Clay bunnies. They make me smile, and you? Happy coding everyone!

Title: The Starry Night
Description: This artwork is located in the Museum of Modern Art, New York

Title: Girl with Balloon
Description: The locations for this work include street murals in Shoreditch and the South bank in London on the Waterloo Bridge and other murals were around London, though none remain there.

Title: Love is in the Bin
Description: 2006 painting of Girl with Balloon that unexpectedly self-destructed immediately after it was sold at auction.

Title: Flower Thrower
Description: One of Banksy's most iconic pieces of art, this stencil mural depicts a masked man throwing a bunch of flowers.

Title: Kissing Coppers
Description: This artwork was originally unveiled on the wall of The Prince Albert pub in Brighton.

Title: Game Changer
Description: This painting was donated to the Southampton General Hospital in Southern England

Title: Gorilla in a Pink Mask
Description: This is the very first artwork of Banksy in which he used a primate.

Title: The Gymnast
Description: Mural on a destroyed building in Borodyanka, Kyiv, Ukraine. On 14 November 2022, Banksy confirmed the creation of 7 murals in Ukraine, spanning several locations, from Kyiv, to Irpin, and Borodyanka. Prior to the artist's official confirmation on Instagram, there was mounting speculation online on whether those murals were indeed Banksy's. A chain of events quite typical to Banksy…. The first artwork to be identified, which went viral over the weekend, shows a female gymnast balancing on a pile of rubble on the side of a building damaged by russian strikes.

Title: The Judo Competition
Description: Mural on a destroyed building in Borodyanka, Kyiv, Ukraine. One mural in Borodyanka initially appeared on photojournalist @edr4m's Instagram. It shows a kid in kimono throwing a man on the floor, for what resembles a judo competition. The man strangely looks like vladimir putin, who supposedly holds a black belt…

Title: Kids Playing
Description: This mural depicts two children using a metal tank trap as a seesaw spray-painted onto a concrete defensive block in Kyiv. On 14 November 2022, Banksy confirmed the creation of 7 murals in Ukraine, spanning several locations, from Kyiv, to Irpin, and Borodyanka. Prior to the artist's official confirmation on Instagram, there was mounting speculation online on whether those murals were indeed Banksy's. A chain of events quite typical to Banksy….

Title: Devolved Parliament
Description: “You paint 100 chimpanzees and they still call you a guerrilla artist” - Banksy
